answers.answer: all depends..could be just the position of the baby thats all!!

have you had your diabetes test yet? I would think if they were thinking the baby was getting to big, they'd give you that now. I think an ultrasound would be the only way to know if you baby is getting to big. You could have to much fluid or as Rosa said, i could just be the way you are carrying. i wouldn't worry about it.

well when my mom was pregnant with me she was told August 18 then october 7 then they said they didn't know and weren't giving a due date I was born sept 30 on my own. my husband was 9lbs 1 oz and I was 8lbs 4 oz. So we were both big babiesP.S. no glucose in the urine

question: My midwife is thinking she is going to see if I continue to grow to fast for my due date first was 23 weeks and 25cm and now 25 weeks 29cm. has anyone else grown so fast for there fundal height and if so were you told they might change your due date or just help you go into labour early because they are thinking it will be a big baby.
title: maybe getting a new due date
